"I'll read this later and get back to you."
"Let's set up a meeting to discuss this."
Select server sent items folder for %s
Send to only in my contacts and outside %s
To configure your account, Gmail is being asked to send account info to %s. Is this ok?
A variable field that supports a specific email address (janedoe@company.com) or templated value ($emailaddress$). EMMs can use this field to pull user credentials from ActiveDirectory.

The complete hostname for the ActiveSync server, such as hostname.company.com:443. The hostname may be accessed through an EMM on-site proxy server, a load-balanced VIP (virtual IP) serving multiple ActiveSync servers, or directly to the public CAS (client access server). Specified host should not be redirected to another host. Defaults to port 443 unless specified otherwise.
"A variable field for user's Active Directory username that can be specified as a direct username (janedoe) or templated value ($username$). The username and user's email address may be different."
A string containing the EAS (Exchange ActiveSync) device ID, which may be used by some EMM gateways to correlate devices.
A boolean value that enables and requires SSL on port numbers used with Hostname when set to True (default). (This setting is ignored when port 443 is used in Hostname).

A boolean value that disables validation checks on SSL certificates used in communications between ActiveSync servers, proxies, or gateways, and other email servers. Set to True to disable validation checks when using self-signed Certificates or for testing purposes. By default, this value is False: validation checks are performed.
"A string alias for a private key certificate stored in the work-profile keystore by an EMM's DPC app that will be used for authenticating to the ActiveSync Servers."
A string comprising the default email signature to be appended to bottom of all outbound email message text.

A value from 0-5 that represents the time window for syncing with EAS (Exchange ActiveSync). Defaults to one week (value=3). [0=No filter, synchronize all items. 1=1 day. 2=3 days. 3=1 week. 4=2 weeks. 5=1 month.] See https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/gg709713(v=exchg.80).aspx for complete information about sync window settings.
Want more of a good thing?
Be the first to test new features and give feedback.
Try Gmailify for a cleaner and more organized inbox
Your inbox is being updated with better spam protection and mail categories. This may take a while.
With Gmailify you get the best of Gmail with your current email account. This includes better spam protection and email categories to organize your inbox. You can switch back at any time. ^1
A copy of your emails will be synced to Gmail and kept in this mailbox. Your email address does not change. ^1

By default your emails will be sent from:

You will still see these emails in your %1$s mailbox.

"Be careful with this message. Similar messages were used to steal people's personal information. Unless you trust the sender, don't click links or reply with personal information."
"Be careful with this message. It contains a suspicious link that was used to steal people's personal information. Unless you trust the sender, don't click links or reply with personal information."
Be careful with this message. It might contain a virus or a malicious link.
"Be careful with this message. The sender's account may be compromised, so this message could be a scam to steal personal information."
Be careful with this message. This message may not have been sent by: %1$s.
"Why is this message in Spam? We've found that lots of messages from %2$s are spam."
"Why is this message in Spam? We've found that lots of messages from %2$s are spam."
Why is this message in Spam? You tried to unsubscribe from this sender but they continued to send you email, so new messages are put directly in Spam to keep them out of your inbox.
"Why is this message in Spam? You tried to unsubscribe from this sender but they didn't provide a way to do that, so new messages are put directly in Spam to keep them out of your inbox."
"Be careful with this message. It contains content that's typically used to steal personal information."
This message may not have been sent by: %1$s
"Be careful with this message. This message may not have been sent by: %1$s. Similar messages were used to steal people's personal information."
This message was not sent to Spam because of a filter you created.
"Be careful with this message. Our systems couldn't verify that this message was really sent by %2$s. You might want to avoid clicking links or replying with personal information."
Why is this message in Spam? You previously marked messages from %1$s as spam.
Why is this message in Spam? You clicked Report spam for this message.
Why is this message in Spam? You clicked Report phishing for this message.
Why is this message in Spam? Your organization requested that messages like this be marked as spam.
"This message was not sent to Spam based on your organization's request."
"Why is this message in Spam? It contains content that's typically used in spam messages."
"Why is this message in Spam? It's similar to messages that were detected by our spam filters."
Be careful with this message. Many people marked similar messages as spam.
Be careful with this message. Many people marked similar messages as phishing scams, so this might contain unsafe content.
"Why is this message in Spam? We've found that lots of messages from %1$s are spam."
"Why is this message in Spam? It seems to be a fake bounce reply to a message that you didn't actually send."
"Why is this message in Spam? It's written in a different language than your messages typically use."
"Why is this message in Spam? It's similar to messages that were detected by our spam filters."
Why is this message in Spam? %1$s cannot reach you via your Google+ profile at this time.
Be careful with this message. Someone might be trying to trick you by using similar-looking characters (such as Σ and E) in the email addresses contained in this message.
"Why is this message in Spam? The sender's email address is invalid."
"Why is this message in Spam? It's from an address in the %2$s domain but has failed %2$s's required tests for authentication."
"Why is this message in Spam? It is in violation of Google's recommended email sender guidelines."
Be careful with this message. It contains links to websites hosting malware.
Why is this message in Spam? You blocked incoming messages from %1$s.
"This may be a spoofed message. Gmail couldn't verify that it was actually sent from your account."
You unblocked %1$s. Messages from this address will appear in your inbox.
You blocked %1$s. Messages from this address will be marked as Spam.
You unsubscribed from this mailing list.
"Gmail couldn't verify that %2$s actually sent this message (and not a spammer)."
"Gmail couldn't verify that %2$s actually sent this message (and not a spammer)."
Allows the app to read your Gmail.
Allows the app to modify your Gmail, including sending and deleting mail.
Allows the app to send Gmail messages without opening the Gmail app.
Allows the app to access information about your mail.
Allow the app to access Gmail broadcast intents, used to update notifications among other things.
